description.narrative:
To respond to some of the many challenges to media and freedom of expression in Palestine. International Media Support (IMS) has submitted a proposal to Sida to fund the IMS programme Strategy 2022-2024 for the Occupied Palestinian Territory with 36 MSEK (12m SEK annually 2022-2024). The Palestine programme is closely linked to the IMS Mena programme (2022-2025) which means it draws on staff and resources for implementation. The proposed programme has been assessed by Sida as relevant and the contribution would be a continuation of an ongoing partnership which is built upon trust and mutual understanding of a long-term vision to enhance accountability in Palestine through an enhanced civil society, independent media and more professional journalists. It is complementary to other contributions in the portfolio within the field of human rights, but also complementary to the overall support to Palestine.
IMS’ main objective of the oPt country strategy for 2022-2024 is focused on enhancing partners’ and other stakeholders’ abilities to exercise their right to freedom of expression in a responsible, inclusive and diverse manner so that they can provide citizens with reliable public interest content and information (with a specific focus on East-Jerusalem, Area C, and the Gaza Strip). Under this overarching objective there is an impact objective: -Access to public interest content published by trusted media which covers social, political and cultural issues and which pushes for accountability and the ability of people to exercise their human rights. and three outcomes: Outcome 1: Wider media stakeholder/community are encouraged and enabled to produce ethical, inclusive and potentially viable public interest content that audiences trust and civic organisations use. Outcome 2: Journalists are safer online and have their rights protected in court and through documentation of press freedom violations. Outcome 3: Media support organizations and CO advocate successfully for laws that guarantee FoE and address disinformation and hate speech.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information
